txt.en: The horses flee back into the encampment

'Well done [placeholder]! This deed will be felt sorely by the Easterlings.\n\n'While you were away, I was able to track the movement of foes near the Morannon. It seems they may already be adjusting their tactics.'
Freed the horses in Lang Rhuven.
'I am surprised you failed this mission. You have never let me down before.'
You should return to Candúr, who can be found at a small Ranger outpost hidden in the Slag-hills.
The horses taste freedom for the first time
Find the horses
Do not let every horse be defeated
You must lead the horses through the encampment
You can tell by the scars, these horses have not been treated well.
A horse has been defeated!
Free the horses in Lang Rhuven
Candúr has been monitoring the Enemy in Lang Rhuven and believes that now is the time to attack the camp.

'I have spied some horses corralled at the western end of Lang Rhuven. To the Easterlings, they are message-bearers, swift scouts, and swifter still to strike or evade in combat. What is more, I know these vile men are savage in the mistreatment of their steeds. Free these horses, and we hobble the Easterlings in all things.'
The horses are now free and safe from the Easterlings
Free the horses in Lang Rhuven
The horses look reluctant but willing to follow you.
Horses can be found in Lang Rhuven on the border of Dagorlad.\n\nYou should free the horses in Lang Rhuven.
Lang Rhuven: The Escape
Horses can be found in Lang Rhuven on the border of Dagorlad.\n\nYou should free the horses in Lang Rhuven.
Return to Candúr
